**POSITION OVERVIEW**

The Packer plays a critical role in the Operations Department at Kangopak. This position is responsible for the accurate, efficient, and compliant packing of finished goods and WIP (work-in-progress) items from pouch making machines and MDB spout inserting machines.

The Packer must ensure compliance with food safety and quality management systems, including BRCGS standards, and all legal and procedural requirements under the OHS Act and BCEA.

Packers are expected to exercise a high degree of individual accountability, discipline, and attention to detail in their execution of production tasks.

## **CORE RESPONSIBILITIES**

### 1. PACKING OF FINISHED GOODS

* Pack finished goods and WIP in cartons with blue liners or as required by job card specifications.
* Ensure products are correctly labelled, tracked, and sealed.
* Ensure accuracy and completeness per batch or job requirement.
* Support pouch-making and MDB spout inserting machines with manual packing.

### 2. COMPLIANCE TO STANDARDS AND PROCEDURES

* Adhere strictly to BRCGS requirements regarding hygiene, traceability, contamination prevention, and GMP.
* Comply with Occupational Health and Safety Act provisions and all safety protocols in force.
* Implement all production SOPs and quality work instructions.
* Maintain awareness of and adhere to Kangopak’s Food Safety and Product Safety standards.

### 3. DOCUMENTATION & TRACEABILITY

* Accurately complete packing logs, count sheets, labels, and other production documentation.
* Ensure initials and other traceability identifiers are correctly recorded on finished goods cartons.
* Assist in maintaining correct batch documentation for audit and verification purposes.

### 4. CLEANING & MAINTENANCE SUPPORT

* Carry out cleaning of the pouch making machines and MDB machines as per the cleaning schedule.
* Complete checklists for cleaning tasks as required.
* Support minor maintenance tasks within competency, based on the machine’s maintenance plan.
* Report faults, contamination risks, or unusual machine behaviour to the Team Leader immediately.

### 5. INSPECTIONS

* Perform incoming inspections in line with the Inspection Plan.
* Report defective or non-conforming materials and assist in corrective segregation.

### 6. MATERIAL HANDLING & STOCK PREPARATION

* Assist in the picking of finished goods.
* Ensure correct wrapping, stacking, and identification of packed goods.
* Assist with additional tasks when machines are undergoing size-up or other changeovers.

### 7. PRODUCT QUALITY MONITORING

* Detect and report visual defects such as poor seals, contamination, or print inconsistencies.
* Ensure line clearance procedures are adhered to during job changeovers or shift handovers.

### 8. CONDUCT & WORK ETHIC

* Always maintain professional behaviour and respectful communication.
* Follow all lawful and reasonable instructions from authorised personnel.
* Use authorised communication platforms such as WhatsApp to stay informed.
* Report to work on time and avoid leaving the workstation without permission.
* Adhere to break times and shift rules.

### 9. WASTE CONTROL & CLEANLINESS

* Participate in segregation and disposal of production waste.
* Keep the work area clean and free from hazards.
* Prevent mix-ups of conforming and non-conforming materials.

### 10. HEALTH & SAFETY COMPLIANCE

* Always wear PPE in the production area.
* Report hazards, unsafe conditions, or incidents to the Team Leader immediately.
* Participate in health and safety drills or training as required.

## **FUNCTIONAL & PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Stand for extended periods (up to 12 hours).
* Lift, move, and carry packaging materials and cartons (up to 20kg).
* Repeatedly perform accurate, manual tasks.
* Maintain high concentration levels to identify and flag anomalies.

## **QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE**

* Senior National Certificate (Matric) required.
* Previous manufacturing environment exposure advantageous.
* Ability to read and write English for documentation purposes.

## **CORE SKILLS & COMPETENCIES**

* Attention to detail.
* High sense of responsibility and dependability.
* Ability to work independently and adhere to strict procedures.
* Mechanical aptitude and process understanding.
* Strong discipline, punctuality, and work ethic.

## **SHIFT STRUCTURE & WORKING CONDITIONS**

* Work is performed in shifts with alternating day/night rotation.
* Overtime work may be required.

## **ACCOUNTABILITY**

* This role is governed by Kangopak’s Code of Conduct and Disciplinary Code.
* Performance will be monitored in accordance with company standards for quality, safety, and output.
* Failure to follow instructions, comply with procedures, or maintain productivity may result in disciplinary action.

## **NOTES**

* This job description forms part of the employee’s contract of employment.
* It may be amended from time to time to reflect operational requirements.
* Additional duties may be assigned in line with operational objectives.
